question: When was the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code passed in India?
explanation:
The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code was passed in the year 2016. It seeks to consolidate the existing laws into a single law for resolution of insolvency and bankruptcy.
Recently, Union Government has promulgated an ordinance to amend Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code. As per the ordnance, a new section 10 A has been inserted in the Code which states that no insolvency application will be filed for defaults arising on or after March 25 for a period of six months (can be extended up to one year).This will save companies which default due to Covid-19 pandemic.
